E-Mail Messages
Date: Tuesday, 4/1/1990
Subject: Retirement
Dear Sir,
It's been a hard decision, but I think I will retire
after this season. It's time to let the youngsters
take my job.

Regards,
Greg Biagini



Date: Wednesday, 4/23/1990
Subject: John Stefero healing process
John Stefero is not recovering as fast as I have
hoped! So expect his injury to last about 7 more days.

Regards,
Team Doctor



Date: Monday, 5/5/1990
Subject: Promotion Day
Dear Sir,
Congratulations, our fan interest increased slightly because
our team won on a promotion day. Good job!

Sincerly,
Your PR Director



Date: Wednesday, 5/7/1990
Subject: Successful Promotion Day
Hello,
That was quite a nice game, the fans loved it!
It seems that the promotion was a success, our
fan interest increased!

Sincerly,
Your PR Director



Date: Saturday, 5/17/1990
Subject: Contract extension
Hello,
I just wanted to let you know that I'm
in my last year of the contract.
Are you interested in giving me an extension?
I'd be happy to play for you again next year!

Regards,
Terry Forster



Date: Saturday, 5/17/1990
Subject: Contract
Dear Sir,
I would like to negotiate a contract extension!
Please let me know if you are interested!

Regards,
Dennis Eckersley

Date: Tuesday, 5/20/1990
Subject: Tony Longmire learns new position
Tony Longmire has made noteable progress
learning his new position, Centerfield.
I would rate his skills as "E" right now.

Regards,
Your scouting director

Date: Monday, 5/26/1990
Subject: Extension?

Regards,
Bill Landrum



Date: Monday, 5/26/1990
Subject: Extension?
Hello Sir,
Are you interested in negotiating a contract extension?
You know, I'm in my final year. I'd like to stay here!

Sincerely,
Frank MacCormack



Date: Monday, 6/2/1990
Subject: Progress of Orlando Miller
Dear Sir,
Orlando Miller has nothing more to prove at AA Tulsa Drillers!
He has an AVG of .313 over there, so I think
a promotion wouldn't hurt him at all.

Regards,
Scouting Director



Date: Tuesday, 6/3/1990
Subject: Lenny Dykstra is sick...
Diagnosis: Migraine.
He is day-to-day, but full recovery will take 3 days.

Regards,
Team Doctor
